catalyst.source: Two types of photocatalysts with carbon modifications, carbon-coated MgIn 2 S 4 (MgIn 2 S 4 -SC); carbon coating and doping MgIn 2 S 4 (MgIn 2 S 4 -Cx), were obtained and exhibited significantly enhanced catalytic activity.The CO evolution rate of MgIn 2 S 4 -C2 and MgIn 2 S 4 -SC reached 19.5 and 7.03 times higher than that of unmodified MgIn 2 S 4 , respectively.
catalyst.context: Convert inert CO 2 into chemical fuel via photocatalytic reduction is very intriguing.However, high charge recombination rate and inadequate CO 2 absorption severely impede photocatalytic CO 2 reduction activity.To address these drawbacks, we developed a strategy of MgIn 2 S 4 modification by carbon.Two types of photocatalysts with carbon modifications, carbon-coated MgIn 2 S 4 (MgIn 2 S 4 -SC); carbon coating and doping MgIn 2 S 4 (MgIn 2 S 4 -Cx), were obtained and exhibited significantly enhanced catalytic activity.The CO evolution rate of MgIn 2 S 4 -C2 and MgIn 2 S 4 -SC reached 19.5 and 7.03 times higher than that of unmodified MgIn 2 S 4 , respectively.Our experimental and theoretical results disclosed that doped carbon for MgIn 2 S 4 could prevent charge recombination in the bulk, facilitate CO 2 adsorption, and decrease photocatalytic reaction energy barrier, while coated carbon could accelerate surface carrier migration, but had smaller and greater effect on fascinating CO 2 adsorption and decreasing reaction energy barrier.The synergistic effect of surface coated and bulk doped carbon could maximize the photocatalysis efficiency.

All reagents used in this experiment were analytical grade and used without further purification.Typically, MgCl 2 6H 2 O, InCl 3 4H 2 O, thioacetamide (TAA) and glucose were dissolved in 30 mL deionized water.After 30 min magnetic stirring, the resulting mixture was transferred into a 50 mL Teflon-lined stainless steel autoclave and maintained at 160 C for 24 h in an oven.After natural cooling, the product was alternately centrifuged and washed with distilled water and ethanol, dried at 60 C for 10 h and calcined at 450 C for 6 h in nitrogen atmosphere with a heating rate of 3 C/min.When adding 2, 4 and 6 mmol of glucose and keeping other parameters unchanged, we correspondingly synthesized pure or carbonmodified MgIn 2 S 4 , and labeled them as MgIn 2 S 4 -C1, MgIn 2 S 4 -C2 and MgIn 2 S 4 -C3, respectively. 2.1.2Preparation of MgIn 2 S 4 -SC.In a typical synthesis, the asprepared MgIn 2 S 4 and 4 mmol glucose were ultrasonically dispersed in 30 mL deionized water.Whereafter, the suspension was drastically magnetic stirred for 30 min at room temperature, and then transferred to a 50 mL Teflon-lined autoclave and maintained at 160 C for 24 h in an oven.After natural cooling, the product was alternately centrifuged and washed with distilled water and ethanol, dried at 60 C for 10 h and calcined at 450 C for 6 h in nitrogen atmosphere.The as-obtained sample was marked as MgIn 2 S 4 -SC.The schematic illustration of the preparation process for samples was exhibited in Scheme.S1.
